1.name: The Third Man
1.description: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

2.name: Trapped
2.description: U.S. Treasury Department agents go after a ring of counterfeiters.

3.name: Samson and Delilah
3.description: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences they both regret.

4.name: The Heiress
4.description: A young naive woman falls for a handsome young man who her emotionally abusive father suspects is a fortune hunter.

5.name: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
5.description: Captain Nathan Brittles, on the eve of retirement, takes out a last patrol to stop an impending massive Indian attack. Encumbered by women who must be evacuated, Brittles finds his mission imperiled.

6.name: White Heat
6.description: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring break from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist. Shortly after the plan takes place, events take a crazy turn.

7.name: The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
7.description: An animated adaptation of "The Wind in the Willows" followed by an adaptation of "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

8.name: Kind Hearts and Coronets
8.description: A distant poor relative of the Duke of D'Ascoyne plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him in the line of succession.

9.name: Little Women
9.description: A group of sisters experience life's difficulties and its pleasures while growing up in nineteenth-century America.

10.name: Thieves' Highway
10.description: A war-veteran-turned-truck driver attempts to avenge the crippling and robbing of his father at the hands of an amoral produce scofflaw.

11.name: The Blue Lagoon
11.description: In the Victorian period, two children are shipwrecked on a tropical island in the South Pacific and fall in love while growing up together.

12.name: Tension
12.description: A meek pharmacist creates an alternate identity under which he plans to murder the bullying liquor salesman who has become his wife's lover.

13.name: Le silence de la mer
13.description: 1941 in a small town in Nazi occupied France. Against the will of its elderly male and his adult niece residents, the Nazis commandeer a house for one of their officers, Lt. Werner von ...                See full summary »

14.name: Twelve O'Clock High
14.description: A hard-as-nails general takes over a bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.

15.name: Red Canyon
15.description: A young girl set out to tame a wild horse so she can enter him in a race.

16.name: Streets of Laredo
16.description: An outlaw separates from his two partners in crime when they join the Texas Rangers, and he continues to commit daring robberies.

17.name: All the King's Men
17.description: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

18.name: Banshun
18.description: Noriko is twenty-seven years old and still living with her widowed father. Everybody tries to talk her into marrying, but Noriko wants to stay at home caring for her father.

19.name: Battleground
19.description: True tale about a squad of the 101st Airborne Division coping with being trapped by the Germans in the besieged city of Bastogne, Belgium during the Battle of the Bulge in December of 1944.

20.name: The Fountainhead
20.description: An uncompromising, visionary architect struggles to maintain his integrity and individualism despite personal, professional and economic pressures to conform to popular standards.

21.name: On the Town
21.description: Three sailors on a day of shore leave in New York City look for fun and romance before their twenty-four hours are up.

22.name: Down to the Sea in Ships
22.description: Whaling ship captain Bering Joy takes his grandson Jed on a whaling trip to teach him core life values while First Mate Dan Lunceford is tasked with tutoring Jed.

23.name: Sands of Iwo Jima
23.description: A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima.

24.name: Diamond City
24.description: Set in the diamond fields of South Africa, Stafford Parker is a lawman trying to maintain a semblance of law and order in the "Wild South".

25.name: In the Good Old Summertime
25.description: In turn-of-the century America, Andrew and Veronica are co-workers in a music shop who dislike one another during working hours but unwillingly carry on an anonymous romance through the mail.

26.name: D.O.A.
26.description: Frank Bigelow, told he's been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find out who killed him and why.

27.name: A Letter to Three Wives
27.description: A letter is addressed to three wives from their "best friend" Addie Ross, announcing that she is running away with one of their husbands...but she does not say which one.

28.name: Criss Cross
28.description: An armored truck driver and his lovely ex-wife conspire with a gang to have his own truck robbed on the route.

29.name: Nora inu
29.description: During a sweltering summer, a rookie homicide detective tries to track down his stolen Colt pistol.

30.name: Under Capricorn
30.description: A young gentleman goes to Australia where he reunites with his now married childhood sweetheart, only to find out she has become an alcoholic and harbors dark secrets.

31.name: Batman and Robin
31.description: The caped crusaders versus The Wizard, black-hooded mastermind.

32.name: Whisky Galore!
32.description: Scottish islanders try to plunder 50,000 cases of whisky from a stranded ship.

33.name: Too Late for Tears
33.description: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even if it means murder.

34.name: Whirlpool
34.description: A woman secretly suffering from kleptomania is hypnotized in an effort to cure her condition. Soon afterwards, she is found at the scene of a murder with no memory of how she got there and seemingly no way to prove her innocence.

35.name: The Secret Garden
35.description: A girl is sent to live with her uncle on his estate when her parents die. There she discovers much intrigue, family history and secrets and personal baggage. In particular, a screaming child and...a secret garden.

36.name: Mighty Joe Young
36.description: A young woman who has raised a giant gorilla from an infant brings him to Hollywood years later seeking her fortune in order to save her family's ranch.

37.name: Pippi Långstrump
37.description: In a small town is Villa Villekulla, and in the villa has recently a little girl, Pippi Longstocking, moved in with her horse and her little monkey Herr Nilsson.

38.name: Ma and Pa Kettle
38.description: On the verge of being evicted from their run-down farmhouse, the large Kettle family is given a new, modern home after Pa wins a contest, but he is accused of plagiarizing his winning slogan by a jealous local woman.

39.name: Adam's Rib
39.description: Domestic and professional tensions mount when a husband and wife work as opposing lawyers in a case involving a woman who shot her husband.

40.name: Pinky
40.description: A light-skinned black woman falls in love with a white doctor, though he is unaware of her true race.

41.name: The Great Gatsby
41.description: A Jazz Age bootlegger learns the hard way about the wages of sin.

42.name: Passport to Pimlico
42.description: Residents of a part of London declare independence when they discover an old treaty. This leads to the need for a "Passport to Pimlico".

43.name: The Fighting Kentuckian
43.description: In 1818 Alabama, French settlers are pitted against greedy land-grabber Blake Randolph but Kentucky militiaman John Breen, who's smitten with French gal Fleurette De Marchand, comes to the settlers' aid.

44.name: Jour de fête
44.description: Once a year the fair comes for one day to the little town 'Sainte-Severe-sur-Indre'. All inhabitants are scoffing at Francois, the postman, what he seems not to recognize. The rising of the...                See full summary »

45.name: Riso amaro
45.description: Two criminals on the run end up working in a rice field and decide to recruit other workers for their next robbery.

46.name: The Set-Up
46.description: Because aging boxer Bill Thompson always lost his past fights, his corrupt manager, without telling Thompson, takes bribes from a betting gangster, to ensure Thompson's pre-arranged dive-loss in the next match.

47.name: Champion
47.description: Boxer Midge Kelly rises to fame...mainly by stepping on other people.

48.name: Impact
48.description: A unfaithful wife plots with her lover to kill her husband, but the lover is accidentally killed instead. The husband stays in hiding, and lets his wife be charged with conspiracy.

49.name: Flamingo Road
49.description: A small town corrupt sheriff manipulates local candidates to the state legislature but he eventually comes into conflict with a visiting carnival dancer.

50.name: Not Wanted
50.description: After a beautiful but unsophisticated girl is seduced by a worldly piano player and gives up her out-of-wedlock baby, her guilt compels her to kidnap another child.
